article_title: Want to use a public ball field in Nebraska? In some places, that'll cost you
article_text:
Want to use a public ball field in Nebraska? In some places, that'll cost you

Grand Island Parks and Recreation workers Preston Gehle, left, and Brian Glover prepare the baseball field at Ashley Park for play on March 20, 2015.

Posted:

Copyright ©2016 Omaha World-Herald. All rights reserved. This material may not be published, broadcast, rewritten, displayed or redistributed for any purpose without permission from the Omaha World-Herald. To purchase rights to republish this article, please contact The World-Herald Store.

Posted in Sports, Local-sports, Nebraska on Saturday, March 21, 2015 10:35 am.

og.description: In Grand Island, it's $30 a day to get a city ball field for youth recreational teams, while it costs $50 a day for adult recreational leagues and select youth teams. At the Smith Softball Complex in Hastings, it's $15 per game.
